pr_title: Send cancel command result if base exception is user cancel exception

timeline.message: Send cancel command result if base exception is user cancel exception

timeline.author: kreedula

replies.bodyText: @kreedula It wouldn't make a difference since in the case of cancel, the result object isn't used because unlike the onSuccess and onError, cancel callback does not accept any parameter such as a result value or exception as is the case with onSuccess and onError. See this: https://github.com/AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-library-common-for-android/blob/dev/common/src/main/java/com/microsoft/identity/common/internal/controllers/CommandCallback.java#L26
replies.author: shahzaibj
